cover.title: Director
cover.tagline: The AI support team that helps nonprofits stay focused on impact
cover.subtagline: Turning under-resourced founders into fundable, operationally tight organizations

slides.title: Problem – Founders Are the Whole Leadership Team
slides.subtitle: Nonprofit founders are carrying 5 jobs on 1 salary.
slides.highlight: Promising orgs plateau at $300–600k or quietly shut down — not for lack of impact, but for lack of backbone.
slides.footnote: When funding tightens and staff are cut, all of this collapses back onto one person.

image.placeholder: Infographic showing one person juggling 5 different roles/hats

slides.title: Ideal Customer – Downshifted Orgs (Beachhead)
slides.subtitle: Our initial focus: orgs that already proved they can raise $400k–$1M.

sections.heading: These orgs:
items: Have real donor and community relationships
Have a history of 7-figure budgets or close

sections.heading: But in the current funding environment:
items: The founder is back to doing everything
Many are considering shutting down despite strong demand

slides.highlight: These leaders don't need another tool. They need a backbone.
slides.footnote: This hits founders of color especially hard, as equity-era funding retrenches.

image.placeholder: Chart showing org budget trajectory: growth to $1M, then decline/plateau

slides.title: Ideal Customer – Foundations as Buyers
slides.subtitle: Foundations can sponsor multiple orgs at once.

sections.heading: The opportunity:
items: Foundations already fund capacity-building for grantees
They can purchase Director packages for 5–10 orgs

sections.heading: Why this works:
items: Foundations get measurable capacity ROI across portfolio
Orgs get backbone support they couldn't afford alone

slides.highlight: A single foundation can unlock Director for an entire cohort of grantees.

image.placeholder: Foundation at center connected to 5-10 nonprofit orgs, each with Director backbone

slides.title: Broken Options
slides.subtitle: Existing solutions don't fit this stage.

sections.heading: DIY SaaS stack
sections.text: CRMs, grant tools, accounting, email… Founders don't have time to integrate and maintain them.

sections.heading: Consultants & agencies
sections.text: Project-based, expensive, seen as "overhead." Advice without ongoing responsibility.

slides.highlight: There is no integrated, AI-native backbone designed for $400k–$1M orgs that have real relationships but no team.
slides.footnote: $360–450k/year for the backbone on a fragile budget.

image.placeholder: Comparison diagram: scattered SaaS logos vs consultant icons vs expensive staff org chart

slides.title: Director – What We Are
slides.subtitle: Director is an AI-native backbone and forward-deployed team for nonprofits.

sections.heading: Director OS – a vertical operating system for:
Director Pod – shared leadership capacity:
items: Dedicated dev & ops roles as we scale

slides.highlight: We plug into an existing org and donor base and give them the leadership bench they can't afford to rebuild alone.

image.placeholder: Two-part diagram: Director OS (software icon) + Director Pod (team icon) = Complete Backbone

slides.title: Fundraising Philosophy – Relationships First
slides.subtitle: Director is built around major gifts and real relationships, not grant roulette.

sections.heading: Grants are part of the picture, but:
items: "Open call" grant-chasing is mostly a distraction for this segment

sections.heading: Director's focus:
items: Map and grow the major gifts pipeline
Use grants strategically once relationships exist

slides.highlight: Director is a relationship and revenue engine, not a shot-in-the-dark grant factory.

image.placeholder: Funnel diagram: Relationships → Major Gifts → Grants (showing priority order)

slides.title: The Director Pod – Capacity Ramp
slides.subtitle: Pods scale from 4 → 8 → 16 orgs as the OS and agents mature.

sections.heading: Phase 2 – 8 orgs
sections.text: Mature core agents handle repetitive tasks. Same structure supports more orgs.

sections.heading: Phase 3 – 16 orgs
sections.text: 2+ FDDs. Standardized playbooks. Agents do recurring work.

image.placeholder: Scaling diagram: 4 orgs → 8 orgs → 16 orgs with team growth visualization

slides.title: Director OS – Product Overview
slides.subtitle: One pane of glass for an org's backbone.

sections.heading: Revenue & Relationships
sections.text: Major gifts map, warm pipeline, next-best actions

sections.heading: Runway & Finance
sections.text: Live cash forecasts, budget vs actuals visibility

sections.heading: Narratives & Reporting
sections.text: Board decks, funder reports, impact one-pagers

slides.footnote: Data flows in from email, calendar, finance systems, docs, and existing CRMs.

image.placeholder: Dashboard mockup showing 4 quadrants: Revenue, Runway, Ops, Narratives

slides.title: AI Agents – How We 2–4x Human Capacity
slides.subtitle: Specialized agents do the repetitive work; humans do the judgment.
slides.highlight: Agents explore, compile, and draft. FDDs and Directors review, edit, and decide.

image.placeholder: 4 AI agent icons with workflow arrows showing data flow between them

slides.title: Economics – Why This Makes Sense
slides.subtitle: Director makes a serious backbone affordable and scalable.
slides.footnote: As Pods scale, pod-level gross margins expand while keeping human leadership involvement high.

image.placeholder: Side-by-side bar chart: Traditional ($360-450k) vs Director ($180-270k)

slides.title: Why Now – AI Agents + Nonprofit Pressure
slides.subtitle: Two timing curves are intersecting.

sections.heading: Agentic AI is production-ready:
items: "AI coworkers" already shipping in engineering, finance, and customer ops
Small human teams can manage far more complexity with agents

sections.heading: Nonprofits are under structural pressure:
items: Orgs with $1M+ budgets are losing staff
Funders want grantees with credible backbones and visibility

slides.highlight: Director sits at this intersection: an AI-native backbone delivered by a lean, forward-deployed team to orgs that cannot justify rebuilding full in-house leadership.

image.placeholder: Two intersecting trend lines: AI capability (rising) meets nonprofit need (rising)

slides.title: Go-to-Market
slides.subtitle: We start where we already have pull.

sections.heading: Existing relationships
sections.text: First 2–4 orgs from founders you're already effectively "directing."

sections.heading: Downshifted $1M orgs
sections.text: Target leaders who proved they can raise $400k–$1M but had to cut staff.

sections.heading: Funder collaborations
sections.text: Position Director as capacity-building that makes grantees more investable.

sections.heading: Sales motion:
items: Short diagnostic: map "today vs with Director"
Show what gets taken off the founder's plate

image.placeholder: Concentric circles: Inner (existing relationships) → Middle (downshifted orgs) → Outer (funder partnerships)

slides.title: Business Model & QSBS-Friendly Structure
slides.subtitle: AI-native vertical SaaS with embedded forward-deployed team.

sections.heading: Revenue model
items: Tied to budget band and complexity
Goal: multiple Pods, each supporting up to 16 orgs

image.placeholder: Business model flywheel: Retainers → Pod capacity → AI leverage → More orgs

slides.title: Team – Lean Year-1 Plan
slides.subtitle: Small, high-leverage founding team with 12 months of runway.

sections.heading: Forward-Deployed Director (hire #1)
sections.text: Nonprofit ops + fundraising, embedded across first ~4 orgs

sections.heading: Finance Director (hire #2)
sections.text: Finance + ops across pod, designs playbooks

sections.heading: Founding Engineer (hire #3)
sections.text: Director OS + first wave of agents

slides.footnote: Target raise: ~$1M for 12 months runway. Early org retainers reduce net burn.

image.placeholder: Team headshots or org chart showing 4 founding roles

sections.heading: 0–12 months (this raise):
items: Hire FDD, Finance Director, Founding Engineer
Ship v1 Director OS and core agents
Prove: 4-org pod delivers revenue and stability lift

sections.heading: 24+ months:
items: Multiple pods focused on key verticals

image.placeholder: Timeline roadmap: Year 1 (4 orgs) → Year 2 (8 orgs) → Year 3+ (16 orgs per pod)

sections.heading: Traction highlights:
sections.text: These partnerships exemplify our growing impact and successful collaboration with influential organizations.

image.placeholder: Collage of logos or photos of the customer organizations

items: Fund 12+ months of lean team and product development
Prove the 4 → 8 → 16 org capacity story with real customers
Build Director into the AI-native backbone for the orgs that can least afford to lose theirs
